intro: Lasiandra collina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray flowers. Lasiandra collina is often used in rock gardens and as a ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance.
